title.narrative: Design for Climate Change Resilience, Sustainable Settlement and Food Security

description.narrative: This project aims to support 2,400 women living in rural areas of southern Bangladesh, adapt to climate change through changing small scale farming practices to be more environmentally friendly and resilient to disasters and changes in the climate. The project follows a permaculture approach (environmentally friendly farming practices) which will train women as lead farmers in new techniques such as organic fertiliser and pesticide production, preserving and storing vegetables, waste management, seed production and integrated livestock and fish production. The wider aim of the work is to form eco-villages which practice these techniques and remove harmful farming practices such as the use of chemicals from their livelihoods. The project follows a group based approach, supporting rural women to improve their leadership skills and technical knowledge, hence contributing to women's empowerment. An additional aim of this project, is to support CAFOD's larger implementing partners to attend training, learn about these techniques and replicate these practices in their own work where applicable. The project is jointly funded by CAFOD and Caritas Luxembourg.
